Reviews.Title: “excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: catlangenhoe
Reviews.Content: This was a perfectly situated hotel on a small quiet square away from the crowds but only 5 minutes walk from the bus station and the water buses there or a 5 minute walk from San Toma water bus stop or 5-10 minutes to the Ca rezzonico water bus stop. It was only a 5 minute walk to Campo Santa Margherita which has lots of bars and restaurants for the evening. Piazza San Marco could be walked in 20 -25 minutes and the Rialto bridge in 15-20 minutes both lovely strolls. Our room and bathroom were a decent size and clean and the small fridge/mini bar was restocked every day with reasonably priced water, softdrinks etc which was welcome at the end of a long day. Breakfast was a buffet of croissants and bread, cereal, yoghurts, juice with coffee/tea etc served in the garden (in your room in poorer weather). There was a little noise from other rooms as the walls were thin and you could hear other guests talking but nothing that stopped us sleeping well and I will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: wilhelmfink
Reviews.Content: This place is fantastic and close to everything you need. There is a Self Service Laundry around the corner. You can follow the signs and walk to Saint Marks Square which only takes about half an hour [more if you look at all the shops along the way]. It has fantastic restaurants near by and it is run by the most friendly family, they are so inviting. I suggest this place for a quite comfortable stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room with lovely balcony!”
Reviews.Author: Anjita1510
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in this romantic place - and had a really great time! The hotel is located in the amazing city center of Venice in a quiet street near a little canal. The staff was really nice and helpful. The room convinced us with romantic old-style furniture and its lovely balcony, where we had delicous italian breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, quiet!”
Reviews.Author: Sally C
Reviews.Content: Just far enough off beaten track to be very peaceful. Do your homework and it's ok to find. Room a decent size and very clean. Window overlooking a courtyard, but not a great view - we didn't mind as out and about most of the time. Breakfast served in your room or outside in small courtyard which was very pleasant. Breakfast itself was nice, could have been more generous in content. Staff lovely and cheerful. Only a few minutes walk from Piazzale Roma - and easy to get back onto main routes into the city.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, cozy hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: vixster8427
Reviews.Content: My 4 friends and I planned a last minute trip to Venice while studying in Italy and found two rooms at the Locanda Gaffaro for a weekend trip. We were pleasantly surprised at how cute and cozy this hotel is, and after walking just a few blocks from the main station we were able to find it on a quiet street. The rooms were large, clean and had a small balcony which was great. The breakfast was quite good and in the patio which was lovely. For us students it was a great deal considering it was summer in Italy and although there is not much going on at night in Venice we had a great time at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and quaint near all kinds of transportation!”
Reviews.Author: Susan K
Reviews.Content: The evening of October 2nd we were wearing a little thin from traveling and had read into the directions to our hotel too much...fortunatly after a quick call to the hotel not only were we given clear directions in English but when we were too slow getting there our host came and found us! What service! Forget the GPS-use the instructions on the website and don't read into them too much. It is is just a 10 min walk from the train station, parking garage or the Varoratto P. d'Roma on the Isle of Durosodura. Clean, comfortable, quiet with A/C and free Internet (ask for the code). We were pleased with how close we were to trains, water taxis and a picture perfect 25 minute walk to St. Mark's. It was a bargin. Pack light-you don't want to be walking up and down the stairs of Venice's bridges with a heavy suitcase. Don't miss Murano! We would definitely go back to this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice little get away”
Reviews.Author: paul52
Reviews.Content: we stayed here is August 2011. The hotel is located very close to the Plaza Roma and is an easy walk if you take the wooden bridge on the far end of the plaza. we reserved the family room and it was a decent size, the beds were comfortable. The big plus is we got the room with the balcony, it over looked a small canal. breakfast is served in an outside patio.The maid got to know us, so on day 2 she would come to our door at 8:15 with a tray of coffee & buns for breakfast which we ate on our deck. She refilled our coffee when asked etc. The location was quiet and it was great not having to pull our bags too far. in summary it was a great location with a clean comfortable room.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time and will definately return”
Reviews.Author: JohnH53
Reviews.Content: Had the top end room in the original bed and breakfast section of the hotel. Only two of us but the room takes three. Beautifully clean room and helpful staff. Quiet location but easy walking distance to everything. Breakfast in the courtyard made a great start to the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: nmoobc
Reviews.Content: I would stay here the next time we're in Venice! An excellent suite, beautifully furnished and spotlessly maintained. The location is very close to the railway station and main connection points for taxi, public transit, vaporettos. If you had to leave either by plane or train, this hotel is perfectly positioned. What has not been noted before in the reviews is their location is very quiet in a secluded but non-descript courtyard. The staff was cordial and thoughtful. We really could not ask for anything more to make our stay better.

Reviews.Title: “Very simple rooms only hotel, having a good location.”
Reviews.Author: miketiscali
Reviews.Content: The 'hotel' is effectively rooms only - excluding a small courtyard there are no public areas - no bar, restaurant etc. Our room was fine and very clean. All rooms are upstairs. Breakfast is included in the price which as there is no restaurant is served on a tray in your room, not so good really. And for us Brits a huge sin - no tea making facilities ! The hotel location is some 10 minutes from the train station in a lovely area. It can be difficult to find - no obvious nameplate or signage. Circa 10 - 15 minutes stroll to the Rialto. Good and reasonably priced restaurant (Ribot) and bars nearby.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: LunaticoOdessa
Reviews.Content: Initially we've been looking for the hotel near Piazzale Roma in order not to waste much time in searching for hotel after late arrival from Treviso airport. Indeed it took 10 min to reach hotel from bus station. Overall the hotel and room was above our expectations. From one hand, the convenient proximity to bus/train station which make easier your logistics to/from Venice and from other hand, hidden place where you can hear the silence. The service was very friendly and we felt like at home all the stay. This is definitely the place we we are gonna stay next time in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: On_the_hill_45
Reviews.Content: We visted Venice in November 2010 and stayed at the hotel for two nights. The location was great as it was only a 3 minute walk from the Piazzale Roma (main bus terminal) and all the main touristy places were within 20 mins walking distance. I say 20 minutes but given all the small winding paths your journey may take longer if you get lost!! You only have to go over 1 bridge to get to the hotel from the Piazzale Roma so there is no issue with having to drag all your bags up and down lots of stairs. The rooms themselves were a good size and certainly had a traditional Venetian theme to them. The hotel had recently been refurbished and was to a good standard. The bathroom was clean and had a good power shower with bedding and towels being replaced everyday. The only draw back I would say about the room was that it was advertised as having Saterlite Tv. This however just means the only channel in English is CNN. I know its not a deal breaker but it is a nice option to have a TV to watch if the weather is bad and your confined to the room. Breakfast was very basic, coffee/tea, a coissant and a couple of bread rolls and that was it. The staff were friendly and spoke quite good English and made a few suggestions of what we could do since the weather was so bad! All in all a good hotel for the price we paid (111 euro for 2 nights). If you're just looking for a base to drop your things off and explore Venice then this would be a great place to stop and I would recommend the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “A little bit of paradice”
Reviews.Author: Gurufood
Reviews.Content: After arriving from the flight from hell via Ryan Air ( never flying them again ) I arrived at this wonderful little hotel in the heart of Venezia. Greeted with a caring smile as I looked like I just escaped from hell at 1am in the morning. Breakfast in bed resurrected my vacation to the bliss it had been. The hotel has a wonderful little patio to have breakfast and read at in the afternoon. Th showers are a tiny but that is something that never bothered me in fact it was always a great laugh in the morning. The location is perfect for what every you wish to see. I will return there on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “nice little hotel, very close to plaza Roma and train station”
Reviews.Author: yoyo_banana
Reviews.Content: One thing we expected at Venice, bridges, one thing we didn't expect about those bridges, there are no ramps to pull you suitcase over. So we had to carry our very heavy suitcases up and down bridges on our way to the hotel. (there is no way to avoid it) And good news about this hotel, it is very close, only two bridges to drag our luggage from Piazza Roma where water bus stops, and it was not very far to walk to St Mark sq from the hotel either. It was at a quiet corner, no noise at all. Excellent breakfast served to our room with delicious croissant (warm ones!), great cappuccino by a very nice lady. We had a triple room with three person in and the space are pretty big for a Europe hotel. All in all, good hotel for our fun time in Venice

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: Travelaura_Perth
Reviews.Content: The location is great for access from the main train/bus station in Venice - only a 5 minute walk. It's tucked away out of the main tourist area which is great, but easy access to transport or 15-20 min walk to the main square. The hotel itself is fairly basic. We got a 'discount rate' off lastminute.com of 100E/night. Venice is expensive and you get what you pay for - in this case a fairly basic old hotel, thin walls (take earplugs or don't expect to sleep in), one of the hardest beds in Italy and (surprisingly) the worst coffee we experienced in 3 weeks in Italy. But you can always walk 2 minutes to a local place and get a coffee and croissant, and the staff are very friendly (gruff but mostly helpful owner) and happy to advise. Cleanliness - ok, just don't look too closely. The toilet brush was FILTHY but hidden away. If you're not too fussy, it's good basic accomodation for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: SimonaRotman
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband were on our honeymoon and our first stop was Venice. The location is perfect, not far from the train station and 10min walk from San Marco and all other main interests. But it is far enough from all the noise and the tourists. Quiet at nights. There are nice places to have dinner near by. We were greated with a bottle of champaign and our room was very neat and charming. The bathroom was excellent. It is a small and tidy hotel. The breakfast was average but satisfactory. I'd come back to this hotel when I am in Venice again :)

Reviews.Title: “SMALL AND QUAINT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Marilyn_Salvatore
Reviews.Content: Value for your money is good at this hotel since the cost of accomodations in Venice are very high. We chose this location because of its affordability and the fact that since we were arriving by train, Locanda is only 10-15 minutes walking distance from the train station. The front gate to the hotel is always locked, and it was a bit confusing when we first arrived because you need to ring the bell and wait for someone to let you in (for a moment we thought nobody was home!). However, the desk clerk that welcomed and checked us in was a very gracious young lady who spoke a proficient English. We thank her for recommending we go the the "Lido" which a beach resort and....... WOW!!...... what a spectacular location. Grand, elegant buildings, excellent restaurants and above all a beautiful sandy beach. The "Lido" can be reached by"vaporetto" (waterbus) which only costs 6.50 Euros per person, and the ride is no more than 30-35 minutes. The rooms at Locanda are indeed small, but nevertheless, all the basic amenities are in place. On the negative side we have two comments; we were surprised that the bathroom towels were not changed on a daily basis. Secondly, we found there was no one at the front desk neither in the afternoon or evening. We understand that even though this is a small hotel and cannot be staffed full-time, if there is no one at reception, there should be a note to the effect on how to contact someone for enquiries or in the event of an emergency.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Quiet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mlanderson
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great for what we wanted - someplace clean and quiet to sleep. The rooms are average - small for US standards. They have bathrooms. A nice breakfast is served each day. Peter was friendly and helpful. We traveled with 2 other couples. The room we stayed in was upstairs at the end of the hall and it was actually for a family so we had a lot of room. Maybe request that one if you are worried about space. It had an extra twin bed. All rooms also had working AC. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Little guesthouse”
Reviews.Author: clairebrookes1980
Reviews.Content: A lovely and really reasonably priced guesthouse, with a yummy breakfast served outside. Breakfast consisting of fresh coffee, orange juice, croissants and jam and fresh crusty bread and cheese. All just seconds from a beautiful canal (see pic) The room was really clean with lovely large and comfortable bed. High ceilings, and lovely furniture. A mini bar (didnâ€™t have prices but the water was just â‚¬1. The bathroom was small, as to be expected but perfect for our needs. As described by the other reviews itâ€™s a perfect location for the main bus station, just 5 min walk away. It's such a pretty and quiet area, and away from the crowds but only 10 min walk to rialto bridge. If you are looking for some cheap evening entertainment the Campo Santa Margherita is nearby, it has a 2.00am drinking licence with many bars and restaurants, that are frequented by Venetian students more so than tourists. Enjoy staying here, take lots of photos and enjoy getting lost amongst the venetian alleyways ï�Š

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great city!”
Reviews.Author: David163
Reviews.Content: It was definitely one of the best hotels I ever stayed in. Hotel Gaffaro lies in the perfect location - just 10 minutes away from the train station and within walking distance of all the main sights in Venice, including San Rocco, the Rialto bridge and St Mark's Square. For those who would rather use the vaporetto it is just 5 mins away from Piazzale Roma and there is another stop at San Toma' which is even closer. At night, the area is really quiet, allowing for a good night's sleep but the bustling Campo Santa Margherita where a lot of young people meet is just a short walk away so it is not isolated. The service was nothing short of excellent - the owner and staff were extremely helpful and very friendly. They also helped us decide when and where to go so as to see the best of Venice while avoiding the suffocating crowds. The continental breakfast which they serve was also good, with fresh warm croissants every morning and the rooms were kept spotlessly clean. Will surely stay there again when I go back to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place in Venice- Will Be Back”
Reviews.Author: noblesavage
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at the beginning of June with a group of college students with me in Italy. Locanda Gaffaro is very conveniently located, we were able to reach the B&B in less than 10 minutes while pulling our luggage. It is close to major sights within Venice but is tucked away in a quiet corner. Campo Santa Margherita is close by with many eateries and caffes in the area. My room was exceptionally clean, nice size, as was the bathroom. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was standard Italian fare, but it was especially nice to be able to take it in the courtyard under the vines. The last day I couldn't because of the weather- absolutely understandable. I was able to sit and chat with Signor Giangaspero who is very friendly, helpful and justifiably proud of his B&B. I am definitely planning on returning.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean room, cleaned daily, good quiet location 5 min from Piazale Roma and train station”
Reviews.Author: juliani80
Reviews.Content: Nicely surprized by the cleanliness of the room, everything you need-air conditioning, fridge,nice bathroom. Located very close to the main stations, but you would still need a map and instructions to find it as it is hidden in a small square next to one of hte main street in a very quite location! Checked in late after letting the hotel know about it and had no problem with it. The man who checked us in spoke good English (probably the boss, beacuse he was there at anytime) gave us a key from the main gate as well so there was no problem getting to the room at 3 am one night :) Small garden for breakfast if the weather is nice, if not-they bring it in the room. 5-10 min to St Margheritta square, where you can eat fairly cheaply in Venice and where students at night gather to have a drink. 15 minutes to a great seaview alley on the south. Would recommend it highly

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location!”
Reviews.Author: dls630
Reviews.Content: The hotel is within walking distance of the train station. The rooms were priced well, clean, bright, spacious enough for two, and comfortable. The breakfast was delicious and the staff was accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Second time we've stayed here and I'm sure it won't be the last! It's a delight!”
Reviews.Author: welshwonderoldham
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Locanda Gaffaro a couple of years ago and had very fond memories of it so decided to stay again to celebrate our daughter's 21st. It was her first visit to Venice and she was most impressed with the accommodation. From the booking of the accommodation to our final goodbyes the Locanda Gaffaro was excellent. It's set in a quiet backwater - we stayed in a room right at the top of the house and with the skylight windows open you could hear birdsong and the occasional swish of a boat on the canal first thing in the morning. The location is good - near enough to several vaporetta stops and also in an area full of quaint and interesting streets and squares. We arrived quite late and headed for Campo Santa Margueritta which was very lively even at almost midnight - most of Venice seems to close down about 11 o'clock. The breakfasts were lovely - delivered to the room and comprising delicious fresh rolls, croissants and good coffee. Decor is very tasteful and it's immaculately clean. We would have quite liked to have our breakfast on the little patio downstairs but this isn't possible unfortunately. Still it's a very pleasant area to sit and recover from the day's walking! I'm looking forward to our next visit - I wouldn't consider staying anywhere else. A delight!

Reviews.Title: “Best room we have ever had”
Reviews.Author: natodawn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were only in Venice for two nights so we wanted something near the bus terminal for easy access to the bus to the airport. We decided on this place after reading a number of reviews. We didn't expect it to be as nice as it was. The hotel is tucked away in a quiet courtyard, but still only about 5 minutes walk from the bus terminal. The hotel reception area that also doubled as the breakfast area was a bit small, but very clean and nicely decorated. The man who helped us was very helpful and friendly. Our room looked like we were the first people to stay there. Tastefully decorated with beautiful cloth on the wall, a Murano chandelier, spotless, and warm. My wife said it was the best place she has ever stayed in and we have travelled quite a lot. It was very quiet even though we were on the ground floor near the coffee bar. Worth ever cent. My only small negative is the signage outside. When we arrived at night, it wasn't clear which door to enter. But it was cleared up quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest room and bathroom ever... just average”
Reviews.Author: raraSoCal
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in small hotels before (like in Japan), but this was definitely the smallest. I guess it can be expected since it's Venice, but after staying in Rome, then Florence for under $100 a night and then spend over $140 a night in Venice, I was expecting something at least up to par, but it wasn't. Right when you walk up 2 flights of stairs to the lobby, you smell cigarette smoke. There is no internet and the breakfast was not buffet like the Rome and Florence Hotels, but at least there was breakfast. Also, maps of Venice cost 2 Euros at the hotel, when we got free maps in Rome and Florence. Luckily Venice is really small and has signs for direction to major places. This hotel was a 5 minute walk to Piazzale Roma, so we didn't have to take to pay for an early water taxi to Piazzale Rome for 30+ Euros. That would be the only reason why we stayed there or would stay there again. My mom called the hotel from California a couple times, and the front desk never let me know or even left a note with that information. We probably wouldn't stay there again, or recommend this hotel to others. It wasn't terrible, but I think there may be better hotels out there.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back in a heartbeat!!!”
Reviews.Author: Valzy
Reviews.Content: A well hidden gem. If you don't know that you are looking for it you would not find it. Follow the hotel directions and you will find it in minutes. Leaving the bus stationp ass the three bridges, walk a minute or two along the water and then make one right then a second right and you find it. EXCELLENT PRICE AND VALUE! Minutes from the bus station and train station this hotel is magnificent. Small hotel, clean room and excellent service from Pietro. Every morning breakfast is delivered to your room by pietro at the time that is most accomodating to you. He is very discreat and he is not a bother. THE ROOM is large enough for a european hotel and is extremely clean! The room is cleaned daily and has an in room safe, satellite tv, phone and desk. AC in room and whole hotel!!! NO ELEVATOR!! BAGGAGE STORAGE!! THE BATHROOM is newly renovated and includes all the neccesities you may nead including a bidet. They give enough towels and change them everyday. The whole time that we were there, there was construction in the hotel but we did not feel bothered by it. Our room was on the ground floor and we did not hear anyone at reception or walking around the hotel. LOCATION: EXCELLENT!! Minutes from the grand canal, train station and bus station. All we did was walk and we did not feel the need to look for transportation unless we were going to Murano. Venice is not a city to lug around your luggage in from place to place since there are so many bridges. If you plan on doing that either take a water taxi to get to your destination or pack light. Pietro speaks english and he is ready to answer all you questions. Outside the hotel there is a water well and the water is safe to drink! GREAT HOTEL!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: lokiabbi
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, we did not read these reviews before booking and would have otherwise asked about the construction. We booked through the hotel and there was not a mention of this at all. The experience seriously downgraded our experience. The green mesh was up all around the windows. But, the main problem was having workers taking out our windows at 8:00am in the morning. The older guy at the desk was flip and rude about the experience. We were afraid to even ask for a refund. The rooms were cute and clean and the location was great. The breakfast was not memorable. A piece of dry white bread, jam and a packaged pastry. Also, the lovely view of the dining area outside. Not that lovely and you can't eat out there. We had the room at the end of the lobby area and it was really noisy and you could smell the smoke from the guy at the front desk. Sorry, but the service here was horrible and I will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Best little quiet place in Venice - Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Sinatralis
Reviews.Content: We loved this little place! My husband and I traveled with his parents to Italy and Venice was our first stop. This was a perfect place for us! The rooms were clean and really made you feel like you were in Italy. My in-laws stayed on the first floor and they loved it, nice size room and bathroom too! We had the upstairs room that was huge as well and had sky lights too.. which was so nice. The breakfast was served in our room every morning right on time and it was perfect to start the day that way! The best is the location of this hotel, it's in a quiet part of town and easy to get to everything. Even from Plaza Roma with having to carry stuff over just a few bridges and the walk was easy, so that helped with everything. The other good thing about this place and it's location is that it is so close to Plaza Roma you jump on the vapporetto and the next stop is the train station.. perfect nice and close! My in-laws loved it and so did my husband and I. The staff was great, they did have construction they were doing on the hotel but never did it too early or too late in the day so it was no issue. It is hiden off the main walk way but if you ask, people are so friendly they will show you where it is at. We would go back to this place again, the price was right and it was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: D8andS7
Reviews.Content: Nice clean rooms, modern ensuite. Breakfast was delivered to room, although was not that flash. The location was good. Our room was close to reception so a little noisy. But we enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “What they don't tell you!”
Reviews.Author: explorefamily
Reviews.Content: The hotel was covered in scaffolding and green netting as the building is undergoing renovation and workmen were noisily hacking out bricks (I think to make more windows) on ground floor during the day. All windows were therefore covered and you couldn't look out or get light in. This wasn't mentioned. The outside terrace is no longer available for breakfast and guests have to take this in their rooms (ours was very small and dark). When we asked if we could carry our tray out onto the terrace we were told by the older man on reception (owner?) quite rudely that this was impossible as they no longer had a licence to serve breakfast there and would get into trouble with the police - all website descriptions of the hotel currently show a photo of a pretty terrace where breakfast can be taken. The older receptionist/owner? was dismissive and unwelcoming, which was a shame. He could have made up for the inconveniences by being more pleasant. The Dorsoduro area is lovely but I wouldn't recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: gdgrules
Reviews.Content: I booked this wonderful little hotel for my daughter and her three girl friends, based on the trip advisor reviews and they were not disappointed. They visited Venice to experience Carnevale. First off, let me say that the girls had nothing but outstanding things to say about this little gem of a hotel; in particular it's location and the wonderful treatment they received from Piero, the gentleman at the front desk. He was very sweet to the girls, even making sure they had their breaskfast brought up to their room each morning. They never expected room service, what a welcome treat. The girls had a wonderful experience all around, and especially enjoyed the view of a small canal from their window a great extra . Great location, great room and wonderful hospitality all at a reasonable price!

Reviews.Title: “great location, good clean service”
Reviews.Author: BillyBoy
Reviews.Content: Knowing that Venice is expensive and small, the saavy traveler will book an inn like Gaffaro for its location, cleanliness and small inn feel. The rooms are very clean and appointed well but not luxurious. The owners father Piero mans the front desk most days and is a pleasant gentleman with a quick smile and offfers reasonable places to eat that are less touristy. Venice is mostly tourists, mostly expensive and you better bring good walking shoes too! We would recommend this hotel/inn for the Dosoduro location and pleasant service. This is not the Gritti Hotel where you will pay $700 per night and still get a smallish room. You will pay $130 per room and get good service.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: IrwinU
Reviews.Content: This was within half a mile of the piaza romana where all the buses drop you off. Peter was the owner when we went during Christmas season. It's a bed and breakfast and the bathrooms are updated, clean, and fresh. The internet cafe (cafe blue) nearby was more of a bar than a place to do research but the immediate vicinity was definitely a neighborhood - so much so that you'll have to try to find this place among the private homes that it blends so well with. While you're there, check out Il Grifone - the leather goods merchant right along the canal. Pick up a sleek card case and some made to measure belts.

Reviews.Title: “not as good as I expected”
Reviews.Author: preppy2005
Reviews.Content: The hotel benefits of a very good location in a quiet place of noisy Venice, it's clean, close to railway station and main attractions, BUT it has also some material problems: the poor power net (in the room you could turn on only 3 lights and the power is off !), the AC doesn't work on heat, the fan from bathroom doesn't work eather, there is a bad wet smell in the room, and above all - the lowest soundproof of the rooms I have ever seen). The host is not very kind - having in view that we leaved very early in the morning and we missed the breakfast, we asked him to prepare 2 sandwiches - and he was not agreed.

Reviews.Title: “Mean owner”
Reviews.Author: Liz789
Reviews.Content: The location was the best part of this hotel. Within walking distance of the train station, although it was a little hard to find. Within walking distance to most main attractions in Venice. It had a nice garden/patio area where we sat and drank wine in the evening. The room seemed very clean and nice. The bed was a bit uncomfortable, and when we woke up, each of us had itchy, what appeared to be bug bites all over our bodies. Not sure if that was from the sheets or not...? The owner, on the other hand, was extremely rude to us. He never told us about breakfast. We learned of breakfast on our last night there when the evening staff asked us what time we wanted breakfast brought to our room. (The man working in the evening was very nice and helpful) We left our bags at the hotel for a few hours after we checked out, and when we went back to pick them up, the owner greeted us with "you are to be killed" and accused us of stealing the room key. The hotel itself is lovely, but I would never recommend this place to anyone, nor will I ever stay there again, simply because I felt as if we were unwanted, and we felt insulted by the day staff.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place to stay in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: HilaryDublin
Reviews.Content: I really thought this small hotel was a lucky find . I loved the location , very quiet but within walking distance of all the main sights . Booked at quiet short notice over the easter period and the first night wehad a very small room downstairs but it was still adequate. For the following two nights we were moved into a beautiful room overlooking the pretty courtyard which you can sit out and relax in. The rooms were spotlessly clean and the owner very friendly and accomodating . There is a great bar over the small canal outsidewhich is mostly frequented by locals and we enjoyed a couple of nightcaps there as the hotel does not have a bar. I thought that the hotel was good value for money in comparison to most venice hotels . It is about a 20min wallk from St Marks square but the walk itself is so beautiful you dont mind and it was so full of tourists there we were glad to be a little bit away.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it”
Reviews.Author: bgcyc
Reviews.Content: Though somewhat difficult to find, the Locanda Gaffaro has been to me a quiet and nice place. In low season, 60 euros for a double room (single use) means good value here. The owner was very friendly, the room was perfect (good bed, good heating, bathroom with shower, tv, safe, mini-bar) and in my opinion breakfast was more than satisfying , but I can understand that for those who are used to an english traditional breakfast it can be sort of poor. The Locanda is convenient to Piazzale Roma (railway station) but you can easily walk to every place of interest and well, places of interests in Venice are everywhere. My stay was totally pleasant and I can recommend the Locanda Gaffaro to anyone who's searching for a lovely, simple and good value retreat in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A true Venetian experience”
Reviews.Author: Falconis
Reviews.Content: While this little private hotel is not on the Grand Canal, I think that made us enjoy it even more. Though a little difficult to find at first, we were lucky enough to have a room with a balcony and from there we could look down onto one of the smaller canals and hear the Gondoliers singing as they came past at night. The room was roomy with big windows and comfortable beds. A big clean bathroom and a well stock and surprisingly cheap mini bar fridge. A true continental breakfast on our balcony was the perfect way to start the day. Peaceful and charming but only minutes away from the activity of the Grand Canal. There are many reasonable restaurant with great food in the alleys around the hotel. The staff were helpfula and well organised without interfering in our relaxing stay there. It truely enhanced out stay in this beautiful, magical place. I would recommend this to anyone, but not necessarily families with small children. It might spoil the atmosphere!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Locanda Gaffaro
HotelInfo.Address: Corte Del Gallo - Dorsoduro 3589, 30123 Venice, Italy
